pageContext.claim: “How about all those states that we weren't supposed to win? No, he won't win there. He won't win there. Then all night long, Donald Trump won the great state of Texas. Donald Trump won the great state of this and that and one after another. … How's he going to do in Georgia? Well, I think Georgia is going to be very close. It's going to be very close. They go, uh, the polls in Georgia have closed. Donald Trump wins the state of Georgia.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a false memory. No one doubted Trump would win Georgia or Texas in 2016. He consistently led Hillary Clinton in the polls in both states, both of them traditionally Republican for decades.
